intro: Brickellia palmeri var. typica, commonly known as Palmer's brickellia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open woodlands. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs, and it produces small yellow flowers in the spring. The species is known for its drought tolerance and ability to thrive in low-nutrient soils.
